components.name: Sol
components.description: Our home star, a middle-aged yellow dwarf that has been shining for 4.6 billion years. It makes up 99.86% of the Solar System's mass and provides the energy that sustains life on Earth. Sol is currently in the main sequence phase of its life cycle and will continue fusing hydrogen for another 5 billion years before evolving into a red giant.

components.name: Alpha Centauri A
components.description: Primary star; G-type main sequence star, Sun-like
components.discovered: Known since antiquity; recognized as closest star system in 1830s

components.name: Alpha Centauri B
components.description: Secondary star; K-type main sequence star, orange dwarf
components.discovered: Known since antiquity; binary nature discovered 1689

components.name: Proxima Centauri
components.description: Tertiary component; M-type red dwarf, flare star, closest star to Sun

components.name: Barnard's Star
components.description: Single red dwarf star; second closest star system to Sun; fourth closest individual star
components.discovered: 1888 observed; high proper motion discovered 1916 by E.E. Barnard

components.name: Luhman 16A
components.description: L-type brown dwarf at the L/T transition, showing banded cloud structures similar to Jupiter/Saturn
components.life_span: Brown dwarfs cool over trillions of years without nuclear fusion

components.name: Luhman 16B
components.description: T-type brown dwarf showing rapid atmospheric variability and patchy cloud coverage
components.life_span: Brown dwarfs cool over trillions of years without nuclear fusion

components.name: WISE 0855-0714
components.description: Sub-brown dwarf (Y dwarf) - the coldest known brown dwarf; mass below deuterium-burning limit; roughly room temperature
components.life_span: Sub-brown dwarfs cool continuously over tens of trillions of years
components.discovered: April 2014 (announced); first imaged May 4, 2010 by WISE

components.name: Wolf 359
components.description: Extremely faint red dwarf flare star (UV Ceti-type); one of the least massive and least luminous stars known
components.age: <1 Gyr (relatively young; >100 Myr based on lithium depletion)
components.discovered: 1917 (proper motion measured by Max Wolf); 1928 (first parallax)

components.name: Lalande 21185
components.description: Red dwarf main-sequence star, brightest red dwarf visible in northern hemisphere; known flare star
components.discovered: 1801 by Jérôme Lalande; high proper motion discovered May 1857

components.name: Sirius A
components.description: Main-sequence A-type star, the brightest star in Earth's night sky; white-blue star with metallic line characteristics
components.star_type: A0mA1 Va - A-type main sequence (Am star)
components.discovered: Known since ancient times; binary nature discovered August 10, 1844 by Friedrich Wilhelm Bessel

components.name: Sirius B
components.description: White dwarf star, one of the most massive white dwarfs known; Earth-sized remnant core
components.life_span: Will cool over next ~2+ billion years; already in final evolutionary stage
components.discovered: January 31, 1862 by Alvan Graham Clark; confirmed March 8, 1862

components.name: BL Ceti
components.description: Red dwarf flare star, slightly brighter component of binary pair; spectral standard star for M5.5V class

components.name: UV Ceti
components.description: Red dwarf flare star, archetypal UV Ceti-type variable after which the entire class is named; spectral standard for M6V
components.star_type: M6V / M6.0e - red dwarf, extreme flare star
components.age: Several billion years (same as component A)
components.discovered: 1948 (companion to BL Ceti); became archetype for UV Ceti-type flare stars

components.name: Ross 154
components.description: UV Ceti-type flare star, one of the nearest red dwarfs to the Sun

components.name: Ross 248
components.description: BY Draconis variable and flare star; will become closest star to the Sun in ~36,500 years

components.name: Epsilon Eridani
components.description: Young, Sun-like K-type orange dwarf with active chromosphere and debris disk system; third-closest naked-eye star
components.age: 0.4-0.8 Gyr (very young star, often cited as ~0.8 Gyr)
components.habitable_zone: 0.5-1.0 AU (current); will expand to 0.6-1.4 AU over 20 Gyr
components.discovered: Known since antiquity (included in Ptolemy's Almagest, 2nd century AD)

components.name: Lacaille 9352
components.description: Nearby red dwarf, closest star in constellation Piscis Austrinus; relatively quiet with low flare activity
components.discovered: 1750s by Nicolas Louis de Lacaille; high proper motion noticed 1881

components.name: Ross 128
components.description: Quiet red dwarf with unusually low flare activity; magnetically evolved star with 4.1-year magnetic cycle
components.age: ~9.45 Gyr (more than twice the age of the Sun)
components.discovered: 1926 by Frank Elmore Ross; flare detected 1972

components.name: EZ Aquarii A
components.description: Brightest component of triple system, part of tight spectroscopic binary with Component C
components.discovered: High proper motion discovered by Willem Luyten; identified as flare star 1972

components.name: EZ Aquarii B
components.description: Third and most distant component, orbiting the AC pair in an eccentric orbit
components.star_type: MV (likely M5-M6V) - red dwarf, flare star
components.age: Several billion years (same as other components)
components.discovered: Part of system discovery; variable nature recognized 1978

components.name: EZ Aquarii C
components.description: Dimmest component, orbiting tightly with Component A in a spectroscopic binary
components.star_type: MV (likely M5-M6V) - red dwarf, flare star
components.age: Several billion years (same as other components)
components.habitable_zone: ~0.03-0.08 AU (part of tight binary with A)
components.discovered: Part of system discovery; variable designation 1978

components.name: 61 Cygni A
components.description: K-type orange dwarf, fourth-nearest naked-eye visible star, first star to have parallax measured (1838)
components.discovered: Known since antiquity; parallax first measured by Friedrich Bessel in 1838

components.name: 61 Cygni B
components.description: K-type orange dwarf, companion star in historic binary system

components.name: Procyon A
components.description: F-type subgiant, 8th brightest star in night sky, evolving off main sequence
components.life_span: ~2.5-3 billion years total (currently evolving into red giant phase)

components.name: Procyon B
components.description: White dwarf companion, cooling remnant of former red giant
components.star_type: DQZ - white dwarf with carbon and heavy elements
components.mass_compared_to_sun: 60% of Sun's mass in Earth-sized remnant (0.602 M☉)
components.age: 1.37 Gyr (cooling age; became white dwarf ~1.19 Gyr ago)
components.life_span: Will cool over next 2+ billion years; already in final stage
components.habitable_zone: 0.01-0.02 AU (theoretical based on current low luminosity)

components.name: Struve 2398 A
components.description: Red dwarf flare star, chromospherically active
components.discovered: Binary nature discovered by Friedrich Struve in 1830

components.name: Struve 2398 B
components.description: Red dwarf companion, flare star

components.name: Groombridge 34 A
components.description: Red dwarf flare star (GX Andromedae), hosts confirmed super-Earth planet

components.name: Groombridge 34 B
components.description: Red dwarf flare star (GQ Andromedae), fainter companion

components.name: DX Cancri
components.description: Red dwarf flare star; spectacular flare detected in 2006; possible Castor Moving Group member
components.age: ~0.2-0.5 Gyr (young, if Castor Moving Group member)
components.discovered: High proper motion first noted by Willem Luyten

components.name: Epsilon Indi A
components.description: K-type orange dwarf with brown dwarf binary companions; top target for biosignature searches
components.discovered: Known since antiquity; brown dwarf companions discovered 2003

components.name: Epsilon Indi Ba
components.description: Early T-type brown dwarf, nearest brown dwarf system after Luhman 16; surprisingly high mass challenges models
components.life_span: Brown dwarfs cool over trillions of years without fusion

components.name: Epsilon Indi Bb
components.description: Late T-type brown dwarf in binary with Ba, cooler companion
components.life_span: Brown dwarfs cool over trillions of years without fusion

components.name: Tau Ceti
components.description: Sun-like G-type star, nearest single G-class star; massive debris disk; planet candidates remain unconfirmed as of 2025

components.name: GJ 1061
components.description: Tiny red dwarf near lower mass limit; non-variable, no flares; hosts potentially habitable planets

components.name: YZ Ceti
components.description: Red dwarf, closest multiplanetary system; three Earth-mass planets in ultra-compact configuration

components.name: Luyten's Star
components.description: Red dwarf with inactive chromosphere; Luyten b is potentially habitable super-Earth; target of METI message
components.discovered: High proper motion determined 1935 by Willem Luyten and Edwin Ebbighausen

components.name: Teegarden's Star
components.description: Ultra-cool M dwarf; Teegarden b and c are potentially habitable Earth-mass planets

components.name: Kapteyn's Star
components.description: Ancient red subdwarf, second-highest proper motion star; halo population member from disrupted dwarf galaxy

components.name: Lacaille 8760
components.description: Nearby red dwarf in constellation Microscopium; variable star AX Microscopii

components.name: SCR 1845-6357 A
components.description: Ultra-cool red dwarf, one of smallest known stars; hosts T-dwarf brown dwarf companion

components.name: SCR 1845-6357 B
components.description: T-dwarf brown dwarf companion at 4.1 AU; first T-dwarf discovered around low-mass star
components.life_span: Brown dwarfs cool over trillions of years

components.name: Kruger 60 A
components.description: Red dwarf flare star (DO Cephei), brighter component

components.name: Kruger 60 B
components.description: Red dwarf flare star (DH Cephei), fainter companion

components.name: DENIS 1048-3956
components.description: Very low-mass red dwarf, among faintest nearby stars

components.name: Ross 614 A
components.description: Red dwarf flare star, primary component

components.name: Ross 614 B
components.description: Red dwarf companion, fainter component

components.name: Van Maanen's Star
components.description: White dwarf, third-nearest white dwarf to Sun; solo stellar remnant with debris disk
components.age: ~3 Gyr (cooling age; became white dwarf ~3 Gyr ago)
components.life_span: Will cool over next 5+ billion years; in final evolutionary stage
components.discovered: 1917 by Adriaan van Maanen (high proper motion)

components.name: Gliese 1
components.description: Red dwarf, first entry in Gliese Catalogue of Nearby Stars

components.name: TZ Arietis
components.description: Red dwarf flare star, very low mass M dwarf
components.star_type: M8e - red dwarf, emission-line flare star

components.name: Wolf 424 A
components.description: Red dwarf flare star, primary component of close binary
components.star_type: M5.5eJ - red dwarf, emission-line flare star

components.name: Wolf 424 B
components.description: Red dwarf companion, fainter component

components.name: Gliese 687
components.description: Nearby red dwarf in Draco, metal-rich for M dwarf

components.name: Gliese 674
components.description: Red dwarf with confirmed super-Earth planet; weakly active with occasional flares
components.discovered: Catalogued; planet discovered via radial velocity

components.name: Gliese 1245 A
components.description: Red dwarf flare star, primary of triple system

components.name: Gliese 1245 B
components.description: Red dwarf companion in close pair with C

components.name: Gliese 1245 C
components.description: Red dwarf, faintest component of triple system

components.name: Wolf 1061
components.description: Red dwarf with three super-Earth planets; Wolf 1061c orbits near inner edge of habitable zone
components.discovered: Cataloged 1919 by Max Wolf; planets announced December 2015

components.name: Gliese 876
components.description: Red dwarf with four confirmed planets including first rocky exoplanet (d) around main sequence star

components.name: AD Leonis
components.description: Young red dwarf flare star with high activity; young disk population member
components.star_type: M3.5eV - red dwarf, emission-line flare star

components.name: Gliese 832
components.description: Red dwarf with one confirmed Jupiter-like planet; candidate planet c refuted in 2022
components.discovered: Known star; planet b discovered September 2008

components.name: Altair
components.description: Bright A-type star, 12th brightest in sky, forms Summer Triangle; rapidly rotating causing oblate shape
components.discovered: Known since antiquity; direct surface imaging achieved 2007

components.name: 82 Eridani
components.description: Sun-like G-type dwarf, one of top candidates for hosting habitable planets

components.name: Delta Pavonis
components.description: Sun-like G-type subgiant, slightly evolved; top SETI target

components.name: Gliese 412 A
components.description: Red dwarf flare star, primary component of close binary

components.name: Gliese 412 B
components.description: Red dwarf companion, fainter component

components.name: Sigma Draconis
components.description: Sun-like K-type dwarf, slightly cooler than Sun; named Alsafi meaning 'the tripod'

components.name: Eta Cassiopeiae A
components.description: Sun-like G-type dwarf, primary of binary system; resembles an older version of our Sun

components.name: Eta Cassiopeiae B
components.description: K-type orange dwarf companion

components.name: HR 7722
components.description: Sun-like K-type dwarf, slightly cooler than the Sun

components.name: Groombridge 1618
components.description: K-type orange dwarf; top target for biosignature searches; potential super-Earth candidate

components.name: LHS 292
components.description: Ultra-cool red dwarf flare star, very low mass M dwarf

components.name: Gliese 440
components.description: White dwarf with strong magnetic field; carbon-rich atmosphere
components.age: ~2-3 Gyr (cooling age; became white dwarf ~2-3 Gyr ago)
components.life_span: Will cool over next 3+ billion years; already in final stage

components.name: LHS 288
components.description: Red dwarf with relatively high proper motion

components.name: GJ 1002
components.description: Red dwarf with two temperate Earth-mass planets in habitable zone; low activity star ideal for planet detection
components.discovered: Known star; planets b & c discovered 2022

components.name: 40 Eridani A
components.description: K-type orange dwarf primary star; Keid, the broken eggshells in Arabic; triple star system
components.discovered: Known since antiquity; triple nature discovered 1783 by William Herschel

components.name: 40 Eridani B
components.description: White dwarf; first white dwarf discovered (1910); one of the brightest white dwarfs visible from Earth
components.age: ~120 Myr (cooling age; became white dwarf ~120 Myr ago)
components.life_span: Will cool over next 2+ billion years; already in final stage

components.name: 40 Eridani C
components.description: Red dwarf tertiary companion

components.name: EV Lacertae
components.description: Young, highly active red dwarf; record-setting stellar flare observed in 2008 (magnitude increase of 8.2)
components.star_type: M3.5 V - red dwarf, extreme flare star

components.name: Gliese 682
components.description: Red dwarf with disputed planet candidates; two super-Earths proposed but unconfirmed

components.name: 70 Ophiuchi A
components.description: K-type orange dwarf, primary of binary system; historical claims of planets now refuted

components.name: 70 Ophiuchi B
components.description: K-type orange dwarf companion

components.name: UGPS J0722-0540
components.description: Very cold T-type brown dwarf discovered by UKIRT Galactic Plane Survey
components.life_span: Brown dwarfs cool over trillions of years without fusion

components.name: WISE 1741+2553
components.description: Cool T-type brown dwarf discovered by WISE infrared survey
components.life_span: Brown dwarfs cool over trillions of years without fusion

components.name: WISE 1639-6847
components.description: Y-type brown dwarf; among the coldest known brown dwarfs, atmospheric temperature similar to Earth
components.life_span: Sub-brown dwarfs cool continuously over tens of trillions of years

components.name: DENIS 0255-4700
components.description: Late L-type brown dwarf discovered by DENIS survey; near the L/T spectral transition
components.life_span: Brown dwarfs cool over trillions of years without fusion

components.name: DENIS J081730.0-615520
components.description: Red dwarf discovered by DENIS survey; high proper motion star
